content: Just curious how entrenched the header region is in Layouts. I am the one porting the UIkit theme and was thinking about ditching the header region and making it a little more granular in how you control the menu, logo and site name blocks.

@tkcent - I may not be aware of every possible pitfall here, but if you are already creating a custom layout in the theme, I would expect that you can do anything you want with the header region - as long as the user does not switch layouts to a core layout or a contrib layout that does not contain your overrides.

All of the core layouts include a header region, but I don't think there is any other behind the scenes magic happening in that region. I can't think of anything that will break if that region is gone or replaced.
Keep in mind - that I am often wrong.
Thanks @StPaulTim - I'm give a try and see how it works. The header block doesn't have a way to configure the menus like the Primary Navigation block and other menu blocks do.

And thanks to @quicksketch for the pointer to system_menu_block_build(). The only problem with that approach is either I hardcode the config or add menu configuration options to the theme settings. Seems easier to just use menu blocks since they are configurable already.

Hi @tkcent I used the UIKit theme a lot, but with a lot of customization (legacy issues with former D7 customers)... I used it with and without a header.tpl.php, really depends on the design complexity. So your goal is to have a 1:1 port of the theme, or pretty close at least?

@mazze.ch - Pretty close to a 1:1 port of the theme. Sorry you missed the quick demo I gave during Backdrop Live of the progress I've made so far! I've got a lot on my plate right now but I'm hoping to get something out next week for public consumption. Looking to put it up on Github. I'll keep you posted.
